meanings.definition: The act of cleaning up or removing dirt, trash, or clutter.
meanings.sent1: After the party, the cleanup was a big job.
meanings.sent2: I always do a quick cleanup before guests come over.
meanings.sent3: The cleanup after the picnic turned into a game of who could find the most trash.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a disaster, but after a thorough cleanup, it looked brand new.
meanings.sent5: The cleanup crew worked tirelessly to make the beach spotless.

meanings.definition: The process of organizing or tidying a space.
meanings.sent1: A good cleanup of the kitchen can make cooking much easier.
meanings.sent2: I like to do a cleanup of my desk before starting work.
meanings.sent3: The cleanup of the garage revealed many forgotten treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her methodical cleanup of the closet impressed her friends.
meanings.sent5: The cleanup of the living room made it feel more spacious and inviting.

meanings.definition: The act of completing or finishing a task or project.
meanings.sent1: The cleanup of the report was the final step before submission.
meanings.sent2: After the cleanup of the yard, the landscaping project was complete.
meanings.sent3: The cleanup of the puzzle was challenging, but satisfying.
meanings.sent4: His cleanup of the painting was meticulous and precise.
meanings.sent5: The cleanup of the event marked the successful conclusion of months of planning.
